question_sentence: A North Korean gymnast is reported to have used which innovative method to escape the country recently?
choices: Folded himself into a suitcase and got smuggled out
Pretended to be a member of a visiting Chinese team
Swam across sea border to South Korea

question_sentence: Efforts to reach a Brexit deal were hit this week by a new stand-off over what food item?
Which sectors of the UK economy would be hardest hit by a no-deal Brexit, according to a new report by the Office for Budget Responsibility?
choices: Agriculture, renewable energy, manufacturing and IT
Retail, real estate, hospitality and education
Agriculture, real estate, mining and finance

question_sentence: Which ‘zombie’ animals have been rising from their graves in Denmark owing to gases released during decomposition, after being culled over Covid mutation fears?
The discovery of what mysterious object in a remote part of the Utah desert has triggered a series of conspiracy theories?
choices: A crashed Second World War plane
Pre-historic carvings on the desert floor

question_sentence: Between which dates will bubbles of up to three households be allowed to mix over Christmas?
Who has surpassed Bill Gates to become the world’s second-richest person?
A 180-year-old phrasebook recently unearthed by archivists was designed to help English people do what?
choices: Communicate with French traders for business purposes
Avoid appearing “common” when mixing with aristocrats

question_sentence: A man was arrested after doing what to express his anger at being asked to leave a restaurant in the Canadian city of Ontario this week?
choices: Battering a waiter with a massive steak

question_sentence: Latest trial results for the Oxford Covid vaccine have been questioned after what was discovered about test patients in the group in which the jab was most effective?
choices: Almost 10% remained in self-isolation during the trials
Up to 20% were not tested for Covid properly
